kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.title: Exploring Morality in Argumentation
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.author:
Kobbe, Jonathan  and
Rehbein, Ines  and
Hulpu{\textcommabelow{s}}, Ioana  and
Stuckenschmidt, Heiner
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.paperMotivationText: Studying the impact of moral framing in argumentation, in particular, on argument quality
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.paperContributionText: Different models/approaches for automatically predicting moral sentiment in debates
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.paperResultsText: Weak but significant correlations between general morality and argument quality and a consistent positive correlation between moral sentiment and audience approval.
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.dataDomainOtherText: Tweets on different topics, online debates on different topics
kobbe-etal-2020-exploring.resourcesOtherText: Wordsense-disambiguated MFD (Hulpus et al), Dagstuhl ArgQuality Corpus (Wachmuth et al)
